oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Agroforestry: Reconciling Production with Protection of the Environment A Synopsis of Research Literature
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Smith, Jo
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: "Organics" in general
Farming Systems
Biodiversity and ecosystem services
Environmental aspects
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is a synopsis of research literature that investigates the potential of temperate agroforestry as a sustainable production system. Agroforestry is a concept of integrated land use that combines elements of agriculture and forestry. An emphasis on managing rather than reducing complexity promotes a functionally biodiverse system that balances productivity with environmental protection.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Smith, Jo (2010) Agroforestry: Reconciling Production with Protection of the Environment A Synopsis of Research Literature. Organic Research Centre, Elm Farm, Research, Hamstead Marshall, Newbury.
